metadata.title: Wednesday, 13th March, 2013
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs what measures the Government will take to prevent the smuggling of mealie-meal into the Democratic Republic of Congo.

parts: (a) how much property was recovered by the disbanded Task Force on Corruption;
(b)how many of the recovered properties were in foreign countries;
(c)how many of the recovered properties have been disposed of and how much money was realised from their disposal; and
(d)what the total value of the remaining properties is.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)what the Under Five and Infant Mortality rates in the country were as of September, 2012; and
(b)what measures the Government has taken to attain the Millennium Development Goal No. 4, on the reduction of child mortality.

questions.minister: Minister of Health whether the Government has any plans for the Nakanyaa Health Centre in Nalikwanda Parliamentary Constituency in view of a high school that will soon be opened in the area.
Minister of Home Affairs whether the Government has any plans to construct a police station in Nangoma Parliamentary Constituency.
Minister of Local Government and Housing why the streets of Lusaka Central Business District are always dirty.

parts: (a)how many people constituted the delegation that accompanied the President of the Republic of Zambia on the official visit to Turkey in 2010; and
(b)how much money was spent on the visit.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education what progress the Government has made on ensuring that all basic and high schools are managed by persons with a minimum academic qualification of a bachelor’s degree.

parts: (a)when the construction of clinics at the following places in Chadiza Parliamentary Constituency will begin:
(i)Navirali; (ii)Zingalume; and (iii)Chang’oma;
(b)what the estimated cost of the projects is; and
(c)who the contractors of the projects are.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)when the Government will construct the following infrastructure in Nchelenge District:
(i)more teachers’ houses; (ii)school libraries; and (iii)a modern office block for the District Education Board Secretary;
(b)when the Standards Officers in the District will be provided with a motor vehicle for their operations; and
(c)when the Ministry will resume the adult literacy programme in the District.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health when the Government will undertake the
parts: (a)introduce the social cash transfer scheme in Nchelenge District where poverty levels are extremely high, in excess of 80 per cent;
(b)increase the number of food security packs allocated to the District due to increased demand;
(c)provide funding for monitoring the projects for beneficiaries of empowerment funds;
(d)start releasing funds for recurrent departmental charges for 2013, for the smooth operations of the District Office; and
(e)construct community halls in each of the thirteen wards in the District.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when the construction of secondary schools in the following areas of Mwinilunga District will commence
parts: (a)Chief Chibwika’s area;
(b)Lumwana West;
(c)Chief  Kakoma’s area; and
(d)Chief Sailunga’s area.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication whether the Government has any plans to rehabilitate the Makanu-Ntambu Road connecting Mwinilunga and Solwezi West Parliamentary Constituencies after the construction of the Kabompo Bridge is completed.
Vice President when the Electoral Commission of Zambia will declare the following schools in Muchinga Parliamentary Constituency, polling stations
parts: (a)Isaninga Basic;
(b)Mulembo Basic;
(c)Nsanje Basic; and
(d)Fikondo Community.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs when the Government will undertake the following in Nchelenge District
parts: (a)construct offices;
(b)provide a motor vehicle for operations; and
(c)increase the number of staff. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W25    Mr Chisala (Chilubi) - to ask the Minister of Foreign Affairs:
(a)which countries were suspended from the United Nations between 1945 and 2012 and for what reasons; and
(b)which countries were expelled from the United Nations in the same period and for what reasons. W26    Mr Mpundu (Nchelenge) - to ask the Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health:
(a)when the Social Welfare Department in Nchelenge District will be provided with:
(i)a motor vehicle for monitoring juveniles on probation; and (ii)new office equipment;
(b)when the number of scholarships for pupils in the District will be increased; and

(c)when the funding to the Public Welfare Assistance Scheme will be increased. W27    Mr Mpundu (Nchelenge) - to ask the Minister of Health when the Government will undertake the following at each of the thirteen health centres in Nchelenge District:
(a)construct at least two toilets;
(b)paint the buildings;
(c)    construct a maternity wing and staff houses;
(d)sink boreholes;
(e)provide surgical equipment and other necessary medical kits; and
(f)provide electricity.
